column5: Uncategorized;The Cambodian woman seen in a Roland Neveu photo taken in 1979 has died.------The image Tuong Oun (Thong Oun) standing beside her two children and emaciated baby was taken by the French photographer at a Thai border refugee camp after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime.------Through Neveu’s photography
column6: the world saw more of the reality of life for Cambodians at the time.------Thong Oun was born on July 1
column8: and she married to Thong Sam having  four sons and two daughters. She passed away from cancer in France on September 25
column10: at the age of 86.------During Pol Pot’s genocide
column11: she suffered as a general Khmer citizen. By the end of 1979
column12: she fled with her husband and five other children to flee to the Thai border where one daughter died in a Thai camp. The family later moved to France.------The children in the photo
column19: all live in France.------https://tvfb.news/article/14649------A 2014 interview with Roland Neveu: ------http://sea-globe.com/firing-line-roland-neveu-southeast-asia-globe/
